section.section: The Commission consists of nine members.
Each member shall be a registered voter of Washington County who in the previous 4 years has voted in at least two elections, at least one of which shall have been in the gubernatorial election year.

The County Commissioners shall solicit each organization listed in subsection (b) of this section before April 1, 1996, and before April 1 each fourth year thereafter, requesting that the organization recommend an appointee to the County Commissioners by May 15.
The County Commissioners shall appoint the individual recommended by each organization to the Commission.
The County Commissioners shall provide professional staff to the Commission as necessary for the Commission to issue its report.

The County Commissioners shall provide funds necessary for the Commission to advertise its hearings so that the public will receive sufficient notice and an opportunity to attend and present testimony at the hearings.

If an organization fails to make a recommendation to the County Commissioners by June 1, the members who have been appointed to the Commission shall meet, solicit prospective members from the public, and select by majority vote a qualified substitute citizen member to the Commission to serve through the following December 1.

text.section: A member of the Commission may not be an elected official or an employee of an official whose salary the Commission studies.
A member of the Commission may not receive compensation.
From among its members, the Commission shall elect a chairman.

section.section: The Commission shall hold at least one public hearing every 4 years.
The Commission shall publish notice of each hearing in a newspaper of general circulation.
